website_summaries.verdict: A good-looking, perfectly weighted and balanced bar spoon.
pros: The stainless steel is copper colored to complement your bar décor, yet won’t affect the taste
It’s a regal 15.75", with a smooth twist for comfortable stirring
It’s popular for coffee making, too
Can also be ordered with a different tips, including muddler and fork
cons: If ordered with a muddler tip, it is knobbed and hard to clean

customer_reviews.title: Misbranded
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed, the "Japanese style" spoon does not have the 'barfly' branding on it , but instead 'mercer culinary' logo. which is the company that owns the barfly brand. I even ordered a replacement to confirm. If you're ordering this spoon you should know that because it doesn't seem to be in the description ( unless I'm missing something) otherwise it's a pretty good spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Fragile metal spoon.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this happening in advance. Hours after opening and after one use my wife dropped it and the muddler broke off. The fragile metal soon is now solely a spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Rich G

customer_reviews.title: Good but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Decent spoon, nice finishing but its flimsy. It looks nice, the handle provides a good grip and the bowl of the spoon and other edges are finished smoothly. It glides around a mixing glass nicely. However... This arrived with the Japanese style end bent. I was able to bend it back into shape with two fingers, which is nice in a way, but tells me this could never be used to crack ice or anything remotely demanding like that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't stick your fingers in drinks
customer_reviews.text: After years of holding out to buy a kind of pricey stir for drinks, you will wonder why you have waited so long. This extremely sturdy stir is long enough to reach the bottom of even table top drink servers (the ones with a spigot at the bottom). Your hand never gets in the drink and everything gets mixed to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Giampetro

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband
customer_reviews.text: My bartender hubby finally found this spoon. Hes been looking forever, and his bartools set is complete
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing notable
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with it. A tad on the expensive side. I returned it because my husband found a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A bit longer than expected, but well made and gets the job done! Fantastic for making Old Fashions, muddles the sugar cube well and allows smooth transfer of the large ice cube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made product. Little long for my taste but it serves its purpose perfectly fine. Would recommend if you're looking for a bar spoon to do layers.
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: Get higher quality
customer_reviews.text: Handle is already bending (close to snapping) from only a few months use (1-3x per week)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Henley

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew how much I would use this thing? I keep it in the kitchen drawer. It’s great for cocktails or smoothies, mixing home made lattes. So nice to have a long spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Britni

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Miles beyond the cheap stirrer I got with the shaker tins.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: fragile muddler part
customer_reviews.text: the muddler part is super fragile. it fell off. that was the part i really wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great hoffman bar spoon
customer_reviews.text: Commonly mistaken for the japanese spoon, this hoffman style barspoon is perfect, especially for the price. Quality build and materials. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nada

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Great looking spoon that I've loved but it's not very strong. I tried cracking a large ice cube with it and it bent after a light tap. I never used it to crack a small cube again but the spoon still snapped off mid stir after 4 months of light use in a home bar.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Fragile muddler...potential quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: Spoon part is nice, but muddler broke of in first use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can stand a couple inches further back from the stirring glass with an extra long stirrer. I have it and a bar spoon, but I barely use the bar spoon, I pretty much only use this stir stick.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Jennette

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for cocktails in tall glasses and looks good on the bar cart.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great bar spoon
customer_reviews.text: Well made with a nice spiral, and for cheaper than most competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Spoon
customer_reviews.text: The spoon looks great and is at the length we were wanting.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's my favorite stirring utensil because it doesnt catch on anything :)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Essential bar tool for home bar
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think a long bar spoon would've been necessary. At first I used a regular spoon, but it didn't really stir old fashioneds in the glass well and it was too short for a mixing glass. I use this spoon a lot for stirring cocktails, measuring ingredients, floating ingredients on top with the back, and I crack a lot of ice with it. It holds up and stirs effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Elegant Look for Stirring Cocktails
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this bar spoon, especially since its gun metal black finish matches a shaker I also own. The handle is twisted into a spiral for a better grip. The butt end is blunt and rounded; although it can be used as a muddler, it is really too small to do that job well. The length is akin to an ice tea spoon. This is an elegant addition to my bar set up. — Debbie Lee Wesselmann
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lee WesselmannTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Shipped Broke.
customer_reviews.text: I would love the bar spoon if not broken. The issue I have was it looks like it was broken and yet it was still shipped. The bar spoon was not in the plastic and the missing broken pieces were not in the box. This is the second item that was broken or missing parts from Barfly!
customer_reviews.author: madprofessor

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable, Muddle Will Break Off
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shorter, antique bronze muddler spoon. After less than a month of use, exclusively for stirring or gently muddling sugar into water or bitters, the welds on the muddle came lose and the disc wobbled freely on the end, and after a few more days, it finally broke off completely. For the price, I expected something of much higher quality than this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great bar spoon, especially for tall mixing glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bar spoon. I really like this length. I have a mixing glasses of different heights, and this bar spoon is more balanced and works well with my taller glass. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: very long
customer_reviews.text: I liked the spoon, my only complaint is the length is longer than I expected. The spoon is tall and causes it to be less stable than a shorter stem.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Sommers

customer_reviews.title: A Pretty Muddler
customer_reviews.text: I put together a gift for my husband, and was excited that bar tools come in his favorite copper (don't forget, the traditional wedding gift for the seventh anniversary is copper!). And while I wasn't exactly sure if we needed a muddler - I wasn't replacing an old one, so I really wasn't sure how much we would use this. Shockingly, this has come in handy for more than just fancy cocktails! Need a sturdy long spoon to stir in iced tea? This works! And the muddling end we just used the other day to better mash up fruit for making cookies! It's an attractive and functional addition to your bar - and your kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda S. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bar spoon but only average muddler
customer_reviews.text: This combination bar spoon and muddler is a mixed performer. It does an excellent job as a bar spoon and it looks classy. But as a muddler it does not provide enough leverage to make the process simple. It takes strong hands to use this as the handle is relatively thin and it is hard to get a grip on it. One needs to put muddle into muddling, and this combination makes that difficult. There are many better muddlers out there, but if you prefer the combo as a space saving decision, this one will work for you. The muddler piece works well if you can provide the leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: As a stirring spoon this is large but very well balanced. Balance is achieved in part by the weight of the muddler on the end. I didn't notice that this stirring spoon also had a muddler on the end until I received. As a muddler it works fine.. especially if you don't already have one... but I prefer an old school wood muddler after trying this. I ordered it because of the color which I like. This has a nice bronzed over copper type finish. It isn't shiny so it won't show wear or finger prints. No need to polish or even wioe clean dry. I do handwash only.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Blake

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Bar Mixing Spoon that Looks Great and Keeps My Fingers Dry and Safe While Stirring Coffee in a Deep Cup.  Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: The golden finish on this bar spoon matches my coffee and cream containers, lids, spoon and plate perfectly and is a suitable replacement for the table knife I use each morning to stir my hot coffee in my deep coffee cup. It is a bit long, but it keeps my fingers away from hot coffee. I imagine this would be the perfect length and a great tool for those who mix alcoholic beverages or for stirring large drink containers like ice tea. While it is not dish washer safe, this spoon is quick and easy to hand wash and dry. This is a handy utensil for stirring and mixing liquids of your choice. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tom McGee

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Bar Spoon
customer_reviews.text: This is a long, cool looking bar spoon. It is made of metal and features a small spoon on one end and round nubby disc on the other. The nub are used to press on fruit, spices etc. to muddle them together to create cocktails like Mojitos and Mint Julep. The spiraled handle is long so you can reach the bottom of tall mugs, glasses and other bar ware. I would be hesitant to use this with acids like soy sauce and to put it in the dishwasher as I feel it could discolor. Overall I think it's a pretty nifty looking spoon if you need a muddler!.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Mellott

customer_reviews.title: Stir drinks like a professional
customer_reviews.text: My monthly book discussion group is in all reality a sophisticated excuse to make creative cocktails and drink. I'm slowly accumulating all of the necessary tools, and this was one of the missing pieces. It's a brilliant addition too—since it serves such a particular end. At 13+ inches, it will reach the tallest of vessels, and its sturdy steel body gives you the power to turn any liquid form with ease. Happy tending!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More gold than copper and not great
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this piece of equipment feels like a waste of money. The handle is not sturdy enough to handle muddling (it bends easily), it's very long ( over 12", so longer than most any sort of cocktail glass), and it doesn't look copper. It has a rose gold appearance, which is not "antique copper" so it won't match any copper ware in an existing bar. It isn't as nice as a showstopper or conversation piece, either. It is also not dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Epilady

customer_reviews.title: Very average bar spoon.
customer_reviews.text: Very long spoon... I didn’t realize it was that long. Make sure to check out the dimensions. Moreover, the color seems to fade after several washes, or maybe I am imagining it. I was shaking an iced drink the other day with it, in a big bowl, and the top of the handle seemed to have bent. I can bend it back to its original place but it seemed very fragile to me. Also, I kind of want to hang it in my kitchen to hang with most of my other utensils but it doesn’t have a hole or anything of the sort; I wish there was. To summarize, not my favorite thing.
customer_reviews.author: Family7

customer_reviews.title: Antique copper spoon and muddler combo
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice looking antique copper stirring spoon for mixing drinks that also has a light duty muddler on the other side. It works fine for muddling mint leaves, but may not work for thicker things where a wooden muddler would work better. The spoon has a twisted handle and is easy to hold. There is a good balance between the 2 sides so it doesn't feel lopsided at all. Nice quality bar spoon, I've been using it a lot and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Makes me look good; stirs the tallest drink or pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I love pretty tools that do their job. Anybody can look like they know what they're doing when they use this bar version of the old iced-tea spoon. Longer than the iced-tea spoon with a smaller bowl, the long, long handle is twisted, with a square cross section. Fancy and useful. It's a good gift for the home bartender.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Boozer

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and works well
customer_reviews.text: Not that there is much you can say about a bar spoon, but this one does look nice so it adds some atheistic to the decor of our bar when not in use (yeah, it looks good just sitting there). It works well and it's a nice bonus to have a muddler on the end of the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda OK

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but hard on my hands
customer_reviews.text: I love the antique copper look and the length makes it easier to use for tall glasses. However, the handle can be hard to grip and I find the muddler end hard to clean at times. I'll keep it for the spoon but I ended up getting a muddler with a wider handle and flat end that I find easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Yoomi

customer_reviews.title: Good Long Spoon
customer_reviews.text: This has a really nice length on it, almost a foot long, makes it easy to really stir. The other side is a muddler and because of the twisting of the spoon it's easy to grip in the middle as well. Antique copper look is subtle but nice. Spoon feels super solid and strong.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: A great bar spoon.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Is a very tall / long spoon (taller than a 20 ounce bottle). 2. The color and finish are super nice and feel / look high end. 3. The muddler on the end works well, I have made multiple mixed drinks. 4. A great value for the money and looks great in my bar set. Cons: 1. None.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Dru

customer_reviews.title: Classic Bar Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived sticking out of damaged package with the handle end bent at a 90 ̊ angle. No matter, it still is a classy looking mixing accessory for a home bar or kitchen.I love the gold finish and the swirled pattern down the gold-tone steel handle. We'll see how it holds up over time, but thus far I am please with its look and utility. ~ Kort
customer_reviews.author: Kort

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Spoon
customer_reviews.text: I have the silver Barfly spoon, but really liked the look of this antique copper. It's really quite an eye catching spoon in person and the quality is very high end. The logo is stamped very cleanly on the spoon. Overall, I'm very happy with the look and build quality!
customer_reviews.author: R. Pickman

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Muddler - long and matches my antique copper
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and displayed - spoon is long enough that it works in even the tallest glasses. Muddler is perfect too, it does have a flat bottom and does not have a curve as I have seen on others.
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: It's Necessary
customer_reviews.text: Lengthy enough - 12 inches - to easily mix any beverage, mixed or otherwise, especially with ice in a narrow glass. It's incredible what I have been missing for so long. And it comes with a 'muddler', too. Not to mention it is attractive in bronze.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: So nice to have.
customer_reviews.text: So nice to have after so many unstirred properly drinks. Works like a charm in a glass full of ice and liquids stirring thoroughly from the bottom up. Gives a good even blend of the alcohol. Very nice looking as well.
customer_reviews.author: PasoCreek

customer_reviews.title: Tall bar spoon utensil
customer_reviews.text: This bar spoon comes in a deep yellow gold color. It has intricate design and it is perfect for making drinks. One can easily mix cocktails with it or use it to mix juice beverages. Spoon is very tall and it is best if it is handwashed, instead of placed in a washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, well made and very useful
customer_reviews.text: I really like this gold toned bar spoon, its long enough to reach the bottom of a good sized pitcher , has a fairly large, wide spoon for a great stir . This is heavy enough to mix the ingredients easily and swiftly and the twisted handle is sty!lush.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Jentoft

customer_reviews.title: The gold color is nice and adds a little flair
customer_reviews.text: Bar spoons are a thing you don't really need, but does make making drinks a little nicer. The gold color is nice and adds a little flair. The spoon is nicely weighted.
customer_reviews.author: anonymousY

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great mixing spoon. Long more than enough for my shaker and tall glasses. I like the look of it.
customer_reviews.author: Bigslacker

customer_reviews.title: Trust the bartender review more than mine!
customer_reviews.text: I know absolutely zero about making layered cocktails. That guy’s review is a lot more helpful than this one is going to be. I like making really big coffees in really tall cups, and normal-length spoons were not working. I needed a longer spoon so I got this one. It’s probably a little too long for my purposes, but it gets the job done. I think the bright gold tone looks totally 80’s, so I’m very much okay with it fading in the dishwasher. The bottom line is, if you have a need for a very long spoon, this is one. If you have more specific spoon needs than just length, then this review has not been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peplinski

customer_reviews.title: Product worth toasting
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes bar tools and assorted gadgets. I'm turning this review over to him: I love this stir spoon. Very classy design. The twist handle provides a little extra grip when muddling. This muddling end is great for citrus. The points make it aggressive, unlike my wooden muddler, which is better suited for crushing mint. This design wouldn't be the best choice for mint. Very happy to add this to the mix of bar tools. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darcia Helle

customer_reviews.title: Looks good -- Gosh I'm fancy now
customer_reviews.text: So its a spoon, and you can use the bottom to smash stuff in the drink. Need it? No. But does it look better when I'm having a party? Absolutely. So much better than a long spoon, chopstick, finger.... it was made to stir drinks in a tall glass. It looks nice too -- not your typical shiny silver finish, but the copper finish is unique. I also have the shot measurement cup, so together -- it looks like the cocktail, whatever weird recipe I'm making for a guest, is going to be spot on. It's just a tall spoon, but the color makes it unique and worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Krykie

customer_reviews.title: More A Stirrer Than A Muddler
customer_reviews.text: This Barfly M37018ACP Bar Spoon, Muddler is not heavy duty so it isn't particularly a Muddler for crushing items. It is, however excellent for mixing ingredients in mixed drinks or for blending already crushed ingredients. It is also very good for use in a coffee shop or kitchen where lattes and other coffee drinks are made. It is very useful and much less awkward than trying to achieve the mixes with a long handled spoon. It does tend to bend when pressure is exerted upon it so it is best used where mixing without pressure is required.
customer_reviews.author: Moderate Risk

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but elegant muddler
customer_reviews.text: Well made muddler, long but not fragile, just the right amount of heft, and a beautiful antique copper finish. Priced at 19 bucks as of writing, could be a tad bit cheaper, but hey quality doesn't come cheap. Comes in a variety of lengths and colors. No problems rinsing and washing. Nice edged pattern at the end of the muddler to crush those mint leaves for the mojito!
customer_reviews.author: Nishant Agarwal

customer_reviews.title: Looks more like brass than gold
customer_reviews.text: This is fine bar spoon. It's plenty long for stirring tall glasses or even pitchers of non-alcoholic drinks. It's a stainless steel that is "gold" plated. I don't think it's actual gold, of course. The coloring on this spoon is very brassy so the spoon looks more bronze or brass than gold, in my opinion. The spoon itself is pretty thick and sturdy. It doesn't bend easily or anything, so that's nice. It's fine. It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great addition to my cocktail making supplies.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Easy to hold, great length. Works well. Muddler on the other end is great CONS: Having two tools on the same item means you have to wash the item in between if you want to use them at the same time. Overall, I like it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Conte

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Weighted Bar Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Perfect spoon for mixing drinks. Has a very nice color and weight to it - makes stirring very easy and a lot of fun. Length is good for mixing in shakers and tall glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Fit for Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Amid the ongoing rediscovery of cocktails and mixology, there is rising attention to bar products that are attractive as well as effective. This lovely, antique-style mixing spoon is a good choice for home use. The extended length should make it useful for even the longest drinking glasses.
customer_reviews.author: James Strock

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made.
customer_reviews.text: Fits just about every glass I threw it into, and is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Romero

customer_reviews.title: Barfly M37018ACP Bar Spoon Muddler 11 13/16" (30.0 Cm) Antique Copper
customer_reviews.text: Another quality bar supply from Barfly. Great as a gift as the Antique Copper color sets it apart from typical stainless steel or aluminum colored utensils.
customer_reviews.author: new yorker

product_meta.title: Barfly Teardrop Bar Spoon, End 11 13/16" (30 cm), Copper
product_meta.description: Color:Copper| Size:Teardrop End 11 13/16" (30 cm)Fine barware for the professional bartender and home enthusiast. BARFLY Mixology Gear has everything you need to shake, stir, and pour the perfect cocktail. The collection is designed to ensure masterful results with a variety of tools for making perfect cocktails. From prep to garnish, this comprehensive line of hard working barware and accessories is designed for precision, control, and accuracy. Add an exciting vibe to your bar or party with BARFLY Mixology Gear professional tools. They perform consistently well and look great.
feature_bullets: Weighted end provides excellent balance for fast and easy mixing
18-8 stainless steel will not affect drink flavors
Plated items should be hand washed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars269 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
